pr_title: Servicebus track2 change LockToken from UUID to string

timeline.message: Initial design option for Locktoken as String
Updated test with string for uuid

timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: The fact that it is a UUID is an implementation detail. External customers wouldn't care; they want to know that if they pass this string into our functions, it'll do the operation for that message. Remove it from the comments.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Return type shows it's a string. "The lock token of this message" is enough.
timeline.author: conniey
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -172,14 +172,14 @@ public String getLabel() { * href="https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-bus-messaging/message-deferral">Deferral API and, with that, * take the message out of the regular delivery state flow. This property is read-only. * - * @return lock token of this message. + * @return {@link String} representing the lock-token for this message.

timeline.bodyText: Null or empty is two checks. NullPointer for when getLockToken() == null and if it is empty, illegal argument exception.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: shouldn't we propagate the same error back? It is an illegalargument exception because it couldn't be converted to a UUID. It's not dependent on the state of this receiver.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Same. null and empty are two different checks.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Remove these debug statements and dofinally.
timeline.author: conniey
conniey

replies.bodyText: Because of the map  will not propagated subscribe to internal Mono.  Thus internal .complete() call was not getting invoked.
replies.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: fromString is a better fit. When you're doing this conversion, I'd check that this is a valid UUID and if not, throw an exception.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: You'll get a warning to use logger.logErrorAsException then throw.
timeline.author: conniey
conniey
